messages.subject: Re: Tp moderators: intro and request
messages.msgSnippet: ... you!!:) ... Thanks for the kind words!  :o)  What we need most, right now, are submissions.  The more, the merrier.  :o)  If you don t have anything to say
messages.messageBody:
> Your timing is absolutely beautiful Shana! I could just kiss
you!!:)
> I'd be happy to send something in or support the magazine in
> whatever way I can.
>
> Ren

Thanks for the kind words! :o) What we need most, right now, are
submissions. The more, the merrier. :o) If you don't have
anything to say about socialization (the theme of the first issue),
don't worry. Part of the magazine will be devoted to what works or
doesn't work for unschoolers, and I'm treating that as a very broad
category: typical day, resources, learning styles, etc., etc., etc.
And, if anyone you know likes to write, pass this on. It's starting
to take off and it's looking like everyone's going to have a lot to
say in the first issue!

-Shana

messages.subject: Tp moderators: intro and request
messages.msgSnippet: I ve just registered www.livefreelearnfree.com. It should be online within the next few days. If all goes as planned, you should be able to subscribe through
messages.messageBody:
"I've just registered www.livefreelearnfree.com. It should be online
within the next few days. If all goes as planned, you should be
able to subscribe through the website, as well as order single
issues, email submissions, find out more about the goals of the
magazine, etc."

Your timing is absolutely beautiful Shana! I could just kiss you!!:)
I'd be happy to send something in or support the magazine in
whatever way I can.

Ren
